00023 /* MacOS 10.3.x has poll.h under /usr/include/, all other unixes
00024  * under /usr/include/sys/ */
00025 #if defined HAVE_POLL && (defined(HAVE_SYS_POLL_H) || defined(HAVE_POLL_H))
00026 # define USE_POLL
00027 # ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
00028 #  include <poll.h>
00029 # else
00030 #  include <sys/poll.h>
00031 # endif
00032 # if defined HAVE_SIGTIMEDWAIT && defined(__linux__)
00033 #  define USE_LINUX_SIGIO
00034 #  include <signal.h>
00035 # endif
00036 #endif
00037 #ifdef _WIN32
00038 # define HAVE_SELECT
00039 #endif
00040 #if defined HAVE_SELECT
00041 # ifdef _WIN32
00042 #  include <winsock2.h>
00043 # endif
00044 # define USE_SELECT
00045 # ifdef HAVE_SYS_SELECT_H
00046 #  include <sys/select.h>
00047 # endif
00048 #endif
00049 
00050 #if defined HAVE_SYS_DEVPOLL_H && defined(__sun)
00051 # define USE_SOLARIS_DEVPOLL
00052 # include <sys/devpoll.h>
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #if defined HAVE_SYS_EVENT_H && defined HAVE_KQUEUE
00056 # define USE_FREEBSD_KQUEUE
00057 # include <sys/event.h>
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #if defined HAVE_SYS_PORT_H && defined HAVE_PORT_CREATE

00066 typedef handler_t (*fdevent_handler)(void *srv, void *ctx, int revents);
00067 
00068 #define FDEVENT_IN     BV(0)
00069 #define FDEVENT_PRI    BV(1)
00070 #define FDEVENT_OUT    BV(2)
00071 #define FDEVENT_ERR    BV(3)
00072 #define FDEVENT_HUP    BV(4)
00073 #define FDEVENT_NVAL   BV(5)
00074 
00075 typedef enum { FD_EVENT_TYPE_UNSET = -1,
00076                 FD_EVENT_TYPE_CONNECTION,
00077                 FD_EVENT_TYPE_FCGI_CONNECTION,
00078                 FD_EVENT_TYPE_DIRWATCH,
00079                 FD_EVENT_TYPE_CGI_CONNECTION
00080 } fd_event_t;
00081 
00082 typedef enum { FDEVENT_HANDLER_UNSET,
00083                 FDEVENT_HANDLER_SELECT,
00084                 FDEVENT_HANDLER_POLL,
00085                 FDEVENT_HANDLER_LINUX_RTSIG,
00086                 FDEVENT_HANDLER_LINUX_SYSEPOLL,
00087                 FDEVENT_HANDLER_SOLARIS_DEVPOLL,
00088                 FDEVENT_HANDLER_FREEBSD_KQUEUE,
00089                 FDEVENT_HANDLER_SOLARIS_PORT
00090 } fdevent_handler_t;

00124 typedef struct _fdnode {
00125         fdevent_handler handler; /* who handles the events for this fd */
00126         void *ctx;               /* opaque pointer which is passed as 3rd parameter to the handler */
00127         int fd;                  /* fd */
00128 
00129         struct _fdnode *prev, *next;
00130 } fdnode;
00131 
00132 typedef struct {
00133         int *ptr;
00134 
00135         size_t used;
00136         size_t size;
00137 } buffer_int;
00138 
00143 typedef struct fdevents {
00144         fdevent_handler_t type;
00145 
00146         fdnode **fdarray; /* a list of fdnodes */
00147         size_t maxfds;
00148 
00149 #ifdef USE_LINUX_SIGIO
00150         int in_sigio;
00151         int signum;
00152         sigset_t sigset;
00153         siginfo_t siginfo;
00154         bitset *sigbset;
00155 #endif
00156 #ifdef USE_LINUX_EPOLL
00157         int epoll_fd;
00158         struct epoll_event *epoll_events;
00159 #endif
00160 #ifdef USE_POLL
00161         struct pollfd *pollfds;
00162 
00163         size_t size;
00164         size_t used;
00165 
00166         buffer_int unused;
00167 #endif
00168 #ifdef USE_SELECT
00169         /* Temporary sets, cloned from permanent sets, and passed to select() */
00170         fd_set select_read;
00171         fd_set select_write;
00172         fd_set select_error;
00173 
00174         /* Permanent sets */
00175         fd_set select_set_read;
00176         fd_set select_set_write;
00177         fd_set select_set_error;
00178 
00179         /* Since windows socket IDs are as good as unpredictable, we need to keep track of each one.
00180            *nix socket IDs start at zero for each process and are reused throughout the life of the process. */
00181 #ifdef _WIN32
00182         /* We could simply use select_set_error, because that is currently always inclusive,
00183                  but better to keep it separate. */
00184         fd_set select_set_all;
00185 #else
00186         int select_max_fd;
00187 #endif
00188 #endif
00189 
00190 
00191 #ifdef USE_SOLARIS_DEVPOLL
00192         int devpoll_fd;
00193         struct pollfd *devpollfds;
00194 #endif
00195 #ifdef USE_FREEBSD_KQUEUE
00196         int kq_fd;
00197         struct kevent *kq_results;
00198         bitset *kq_read_bevents;
00199         bitset *kq_write_bevents;
00200 #endif
00201 #ifdef USE_SOLARIS_PORT
00202         int port_fd;
00203 #endif
00204         int (*reset)(struct fdevents *ev);
00205         void (*free)(struct fdevents *ev);
00206 
00207         int (*event_add)(struct fdevents *ev, iosocket *sock, int events);
00208         int (*event_del)(struct fdevents *ev, iosocket *sock);
00209         int (*get_revents)(struct fdevents *ev, size_t event_count, fdevent_revents *revents);
00210 
00211         int (*poll)(struct fdevents *ev, int timeout_ms);
00212 
00213         int (*fcntl_set)(struct fdevents *ev, int fd);
00214 } fdevents;

00219         const char *description;
